title: User Risk Policy Strategist
content:
Who we are 
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies - from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups - use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone's reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
As Stripe continues to develop innovative products that serve businesses of all sizes around the world, risk will increase in complexity and scale. As part of the User Risk Advisory team, you will protect and advance Stripe’s business, brand and mission, by deploying industry-leading policies that instill user and partner trust in Stripe, while enabling business growth.
What you’ll do
As a member of this team, you will have a deep understanding of Stripe’s risk policies, which include areas such as partnerships, regulatory, credit, and fraud risks. You will provide expert guidance to the business and to our most strategic customers in navigating complex areas to enable product launches and increase revenue. 
We are looking for someone who is passionate about navigating ambiguity, enabling business growth while balancing risk, and is skilled at identifying ways to improve user experience.
Responsibilities

Drive risk policy strategy for company-level strategic initiatives, including partnering with Stripe’s largest users to align on joint priorities, design policy roadmaps, and advise on risk best practices
Partner with cross functional stakeholders - including Sales, Partnerships, Legal, Financial Crimes, Engineering, and Data Science - to identify and build effective risk mitigations
Assess Stripe’s current risk performance and develop and prioritize long-term strategic plans for future growth. Perform analysis and research to inform decision-making, and improve observability in partnership with the Data Science team
Represent Stripe in external engagements with our most critical partners and customers
Enable user onboarding to safely grow at scale, continuously optimizing for efficiency and effectiveness, and staying hyper focused on a positive user experience
Challenge the status quo and provide multiple alternative solutions and key execution criteria
Continue learning about the payments space through industry engagement and independent research, and scale your knowledge to others
Execute special projects/ad hoc analyses, as initiatives, products, risks, and opportunities are constantly evolving

Who you are
We're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements

6+ years of professional experience, preferably in Financial Services, Payments or fintech industries
5+ years experience in a related role (risk, compliance and/or product enablement)
Experience in developing risk solutions and strategies and working with technical (product and engineering) and operational teams
Ability to distill complex, ambiguous risk and policy problems into clear, concise, and reliable guidance for internal stakeholders and Stripe users
Exceptional collaboration and communication skills, with an ability to influence stakeholders across functions and borders, while remaining calm and responsive under pressure
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
A results- and action-oriented mindset and the ability to lead and motivate others
The ability to take ownership, be accountable, and drive towards ambitious goals
Comfort operating in an ambiguous and quickly changing environment with shifting priorities (this is a must!) 

Preferred qualifications

Previous experience working in the financial or tech sectors, particularly within a risk management or revenue enablement function
Proficiency in one of the following:

Card network rules and regulations 
Merchant acquiring rules and regulations
KYC/KYB, AML OFAC compliance 


Experience overseeing execution and delivery of programs/projects. Ability to take complex issues and turn them into actionable next steps
SQL proficiency
Advanced degree in law, business, policy or other related field

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
